title: Administrative Manager Job at Haven Hauling
content:
Haven Hauling is a logistics and export business that is part of the Johnvents Group, committed to the safe and timely delivery of goods. Backed by a modern transport fleet and a highly experienced freight and export team, we ensure efficient and reliable movement of products to their destinations, both locally and internationally.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager

Job Location: Owo, Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organised Administrative Manager to oversee the day-to-day administrative functions that support our logistics and fleet operations.
	This role is central to ensuring the smooth running of office systems, compliance processes, documentation, and interdepartmental coordination.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily office operations, including facility management, cleanliness, supplies, safety, and overall organisation of the workplace.
	Supervise front desk operations, ensuring professional handling of calls, correspondence, and visitors.
	Manage the administrative team, including onboarding, training, work schedules, and performance monitoring.
	Maintain up-to-date and accurate administrative records, including fleet documentation, insurance, employee files, and compliance logs.
	Collaborate closely with fleet, HR, finance, and operations teams to ensure effective internal coordination and communication.
	Manage procurement of office equipment and supplies, ensuring cost efficiency through vendor negotiation and planning.
	Monitor administrative budgets and track office-related expenditures.
	Ensure effective filing systems, proper documentation, and secure data management for easy retrieval and audit readiness.
	Generate and submit administrative reports on office operations, compliance, and record-keeping.
	Ensure compliance with relevant health, safety, administrative, and transport regulations.
	Coordinate third-party services including cleaning, maintenance, and equipment repair.
	Organise internal meetings, travel logistics, staff events, and support conference planning in line with company policies.
	Introduce and manage office systems and tools to improve administrative efficiency and workflow.
	Enforce workplace safety and emergency procedures, including fire safety and evacuation protocols.
	Manage company insurance portfolios, including property, liability, and vehicle policies.
	Oversee vehicle-related administrative tasks such as insurance renewals, registrations, documentation, and fleet records.


Specification


	A Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in an administrative role, preferably within logistics or transport services.
	Strong organisational and multitasking abilities, with excellent attention to detail.
	Proven team leadership experience and interpersonal skills.
	Familiarity with compliance and transport documentation requirements.
	Good written and verbal communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: applications@capitalsage.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
